text: Hey Everyone, I'm attempting to use the Web Analytics endpoint in a React Card. I'm getting an error on the api call that it's out of scope, and needs either of these permissions - [event-detail-read,web-analytics-api-access]. I do not see these permissions in Private Apps, what do I need to do to have them listed there? It is in beta, but I didn't see it in the list to join (I may just be missing it). Thanks in advance for your help!

:rocket: *[Developer Project Platform Version 2023.2 Release in Public Beta]* :rocket:

Hello fellow developers! We are happy to announce the release of <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog/developer-projects-platform-version-2023.2|Project Platform Version 2023.2>, the first version for the new <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/platform-versioning|versioning mechanism> that we are implementing for <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/create-a-project|Developer Projects>. Users can now easily update their software to new platform versions containing the latest changes, rollback to previous versions, and manage any breaking changes in a more coordinated fashion. :developers-developers-developers:

*Platform version 2023.2* includes the following new features:

• *Support for asynchronous functions for App Functions (Async Await support)*
• *Removal of 4KB limits for CRM card logs and integration with an improved logging system* that will enable log tracing feature for CRM custom cards in the near future (_coming soon!_)
• *Control Node version through platform version (v2023.2 will point to Node 18)* - Simply update your platform version to get the latest Node version!
• *Endpoint function deprecation for CMS on Projects* - App Functions will replace Endpoint Functions for Projects
• *JSON custom card deprecation* - You will no longer be able to use JSON cards for v2023.2 (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog/upcoming-sunset-json-custom-cards|sunset announcement>). Instead, you'll need to update to React custom cards.
Simply update your platform version to 2023.2 following the instructions in the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/platform-versioning|Project Platform Versioning> documentation to get access to these features. The previous platform version (2023.1) is on path to deprecation on *March 2024.*

You can refer to the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog/developer-projects-platform-version-2023.2|changelog announcement> and <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/platform-versioning|Project Platform Versioning> documentation for more details and instructions! :sprocket-dance:
